item.title: Counter-Strike 2 3/31 Update: New Armory, Weekly Care Package Skins, and a Bigger Banana
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/counter-strike-2-3-31-update-new-armory-weekly-care-package-skins-and-a-bigger-banana/

It’s no April Fool’s Day joke: Valve has dropped their latest Counter-Strike 2 update on March 31st, featuring a handful of new weapon skins and a “clean up” Inferno and Train. It’s no brand new operation, but it’s a pretty sizable update to CS2 compared to others.

Counter-Strike 2 March 31st Update – New Changes

The CS2 weekly care package feature now includes three new weapon collections added to the drop list: Ascent, Boreal, and Radiant. The new collections have added “over 70 new [weapon] finishes,” featuring a wide variety of styles. It doesn’t appear that players will get to choose which weapon collection their weekly care package skin comes from, but it does increase the variety of skins that appear.

New skins aren’t exclusive to just the weekly care package for this update. A new case and a new weapon skin collection have been added to the Armory. Players can acquire the Fever case from the Armory page for two credits. By purchasing a Fever case key, players can open their case for a chance at the AWP Printstream or get extremely lucky and open one of several Shattered Web knives in Chroma finishes. Players can also spend four Armory credits to get one random skin from the new Train collection. The “limited edition” item has also been swapped out, and players can save 15 credits for one of the XM1014 Solitude variants. This items will be removed from the Armory on Sunday, July 13.

As for gameplay changes, Inferno and Train and have been hit with some “spring cleaning.” Both maps now feature some “cleaner surfaces, less clutter,” and a noticeably wider Banana section (B Main area) on Inferno specifically.

Any new skins in particular catch your eye? Let us know which one is your favorite in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: All The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered PC System Requirements—Minimum, Recommended & Best Specs
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ail-the-last-of-us-part-2-remastered-pc-system-requirements/

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered makes its bow on PC, broadening the game’s availability. The survival title already looked unbelievable on consoles, so let’s tell you its PC specs and system requirements to have you clacking at Clickers in no time.

The Last of Us Part 1 Remastered came to PC, so it makes sense for The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered to follow suit. Naughty Dog’s award-winning sequel is here in all its remastered and revitalized glory. It features the complete dual-narrative of The Last of Us Part 2 but comes with lots of new features.

Not everyone’s PC setup is the same. This is why system requirements are important before a game’s release. Naughty Dog has unveiled the entire list of PC specs and requirements here, and you should look to see which tier you are compatible with.

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered Minimum Requirements on PC

The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered’s requirements are split into four categories: Minimum, Recommended, High, and Very High settings. Minimum is what you need to run Part 2 at all. We need to hit these requirements to ensure the game works and we don’t run into any problems.

The game runs better the closer you get to “Very High.” This is reserved for the most elite gaming configurations though, so don’t be disheartened if you fall short of the requirements.
